title: Trump signs order to give US control over AI rules
snippets: The executive order is the latest in a series of attempts by the Trump administration to hold back state-level AI rules. But many Republicans are also uncomfortable with the effort.
Trump signs executive order targeting state AI laws Axios

On Thursday evening, with White House AI and crypto czar David Sacks looking over his shoulder, Donald Trump signed an executive order aiming to grab unilateral power over regulating artificial intelligence for the federal government. The order can't by itself unilaterally override state AI laws, bu
President Trump's executive order, which limits the power of states in regulating AI, is a win for big tech companies that have lobbied for a federal standard.
Trump has said that AI would be "destroyed in its infancy" if companies have to comply with 50 different sets of regulations.
titles: Trump is trying to preempt state AI laws via an executive order. It may not be legal

summary: On December 12, 2025, former President Donald Trump signed an executive order seeking to limit state authority over artificial intelligence regulation and promote a unified federal approach. The order, supported by big tech firms, does not override state AI laws but aims to establish federal primacy. Some Republicans have expressed concerns about the move.
